snippet: With the focus on the government shutdown and a battle over health care and debt funding, few in Congress are giving much thought to immigration issues.
abstract: Thousands of supporters of immigration overhaul hold rallies at more than 150 sites in 40 states, trying to pressure Congress to focus on passing pathway to citizenship for millions of immigrants in country illegally; express concern that focus on government shutdown and battle over health care and debt funding is distracting lawmakers from pressing immigration issue.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jess Bidgood from Boston, Christina Cappecchi from Minneapolis, Rob Davis from San Diego, and Kirk Semple from New York.

lead_paragraph: With the focus on the government shutdown and a battle over health care and debt funding, few in Congress are giving much thought to immigration issues.

headline.main: Thousands Rally Nationwide in Support of an Immigration Overhaul
headline.print_headline: Thousands Rally Nationwide in Support of an Immigration Overhaul
